description:
I've been using the Windoze version of Subtitle Editor (running Win 11 in VirtualBox) but now that this dew-fresh update is available that's a thing of the past. SE works well, does what says on the box, and is a joy to work with. It's stable (even on Ubuntu 18.04) and reviews complaining about it being outdated are... well, outdated.

My only criticism (which is why I'm giving it only four stars) is that the UI has some flaws. Some UI text is extremely small (sometimes impossible to read) and does not respond to font adjustments in the preferences. On some buttons the labels are missing completely.

Oh, and it's only available as a snap package, which I hate for reasons of performance and the inability to access the parts of my file system where I keep my data, but that's a snap issue and not related to SE.
summary: Excellent, except for a few UI issues

description: Interface is strange and not responsible. the file system navigation has a lot of bugs and the app keep closing and stopping work properly.

I had an srt file that had errors and gaupol would crash every time tried to edit the text. Subtitle edit opened it perfectly and saved it! Also tried a translate - also worked perfectly! Full marks from me!!
Worked well for me. I used it to add subtitles to a 5 min video I'd made and it did the job very well. I'd recommend it.
summary: worked well to add subtitles to my short video

description: works, easy to use, also for noobs

Are you going to update the SW to the latest version, 3.5.13 was released January 2020, more than 3,5 years ago.
Secondly why doesn't the information tell where the we homepage is?
I assume it is
https://www.nikse.dk/
and
https://github.com/SubtitleEdit/subtitleedit
?
Tiene todo las herramientas necesarias para editar archivos de subtítulos.

Demande un petit temps pour comprendre l'interface. Ne tardez pas à apprendre les raccourcis, l'expérience en sera meilleure et vous gagnerez en efficacité.
Sinon l'interface date un peu, ça pique légèrement les yeux.
